data.onePageSummary: The iPhone SE 4 (based on GSMArena specs) features a compact 4-inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 640x1136 pixels and Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It runs on Apple's A9 chipset with a dual-core CPU and PowerVR GT7600 GPU, paired with up to 128GB of NVMe storage and 2GB RAM. The main camera is a 12MP sensor with PDAF and dual-LED flash, capable of 4K video recording, while the selfie camera is a modest 1.2MP unit. Battery capacity is 1624 mAh with an endurance rating of 73 hours. The device includes a front-mounted fingerprint sensor, NFC for Apple Pay, and supports iOS updates up to version 15.8.4 from its original iOS 9 launch OS. Design-wise, it uses an aluminum frame and back with a lightweight build of 113g.
cons: Small display by modern standards (mentioned: GSMArena)

Camera.explanation: 12MP main camera with PDAF and 4K video, but basic 1.2MP selfie camera and no low-light specifics mentioned.

Battery Endurance.explanation: 1624 mAh battery with 73h endurance rating; charging speed and degradation not detailed.

Performance.explanation: Apple A9 chip with dual-core CPU; sustained performance and thermals not tested in review.

Display.explanation: 4-inch IPS LCD with 326 ppi; brightness and eye comfort metrics not provided.

Software Experience.explanation: iOS with long update history (up to iOS 15), but no specifics on cleanliness or bug rate.

Design & Build.explanation: Aluminum build at 113g offers good portability; haptics and durability not detailed.

Longevity Value.explanation: Inferred long software support and current low price enhance value; resale/repairability not mentioned.
